name: queue-build
description: Start new build(s) in your Team Project
author: jb

inputs.name: buildDefinitionName
inputs.label: Build Definition Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to your build definitions. Multiple definitions are separated by a new line. For further instructions check the extension page.

inputs.name: buildConfigurationType
inputs.label: Configuration type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the build configuration interpretation type. E.g.: Use JavaScript if you need to support a single backslash.

inputs.name: buildConfiguration
inputs.label: Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify queue build parameters. 
 Example: 
 { "sourceBranch": null, "sourceVersion": null, "parameters": { "system.debug": true } }. 

 Further information: https://github.com/bamminger/vsts-queue-build

inputs.name: teamProjectType
inputs.label: Team Project type
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Team project selection type. 

 Current = Team project of the Build/Release definition, 
 Defined = Team project specified in text field 
 JSON Configuration = Team project defined in Configuration field 

 Further information: https://github.com/bamminger/vsts-queue-build

inputs.name: teamProject
inputs.label: Team Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the team project where the builds should be queued.

inputs.name: async
inputs.label: Async
inputs.helpMarkDown: The async flag defines whether the build task waits till the builds are finished or just queues them.

inputs.name: requestedFor
inputs.label: Use Requester User
inputs.helpMarkDown: Activate this checkbox to use the same requester user for the queue builds that was used for the current build/release.

inputs.name: buildIdOutputVariable
inputs.label: Build Id Output Variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Variable name used to write the resulting build id's.

inputs.name: writeBuildSummary
inputs.label: Write build summary
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable build summary. Information about the queued builds will be shown at the build summary page.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.label: Debug
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable debug mode. Additional information about your build definitions and the processed input will be provided.
